fields.name: balance
fields.description: Current balance, if any, being stored on the customer. If negative, the customer has credit to apply to their next invoice. If positive, the customer has an amount owed that will be added to their next invoice. The balance does not refer to any unpaid invoices; it solely takes into account amounts that have yet to be successfully applied to any invoice. This balance is only taken into account as invoices are finalized.

fields.name: currency
fields.description: Three-letter ISO code for the currency the customer can be charged in for recurring billing purposes.

fields.name: description
fields.description: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users.

fields.name: email
fields.description: The customer's email address.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the object.

fields.name: invoice prefix
fields.description: The prefix for the customer used to generate unique invoice numbers.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The customer's full name or business name.

fields.name: next invoice sequence
fields.description: The suffix of the customer's next invoice number, e.g., 0001.

fields.name: phone
fields.description: The customer's phone number.

fields.name: tax exempt
fields.description: Describes the customer's tax exemption status. One of none, exempt, or reverse. When set to reverse, invoice and receipt PDFs include the text "Reverse charge".

fields.name: city
fields.description: City, district, suburb, town, or village.

fields.name: country
fields.description: Two-letter country code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2).

fields.name: line1
fields.description: Address line 1 (e.g., street, PO Box, or company name).

fields.name: line2
fields.description: Address line 2 (e.g., apartment, suite, unit, or building).

fields.name: postal code
fields.description: ZIP or postal code.

fields.name: state
fields.description: State, county, province, or region.

fields.name: checkout session
fields.description: The Checkout session that this coupon is applied to, if it is applied to a particular session in payment mode. Will not be present for subscription mode.

fields.name: end
fields.description: If the coupon has a duration of repeating, the date that this discount will end. If the coupon has a duration of once or forever, this attribute will be null.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the discount object. Discounts cannot be fetched by ID. Use expand[]=discounts in API calls to expand discount IDs in an array.

fields.name: invoice
fields.description: The invoice that the discount's coupon was applied to, if it was applied directly to a particular invoice.

fields.name: invoice item
fields.description: The invoice item id (or invoice line item id for invoice line items of type='subscription') that the discount's coupon was applied to, if it was applied directly to a particular invoice item or invoice line item.

fields.name: start
fields.description: Date that the coupon was applied.

fields.name: subscription
fields.description: The subscription that this coupon is applied to, if it is applied to a particular subscription.

fields.name: footer
fields.description: Default footer to be displayed on invoices for this customer.

fields.name: carrier
fields.description: The delivery service that shipped a physical product, such as Fedex, UPS, USPS, etc.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Recipient name.

fields.name: phone
fields.description: Recipient phone (including extension).

fields.name: tracking number
fields.description: The tracking number for a physical product, obtained from the delivery service. If multiple tracking numbers were generated for this purchase, please separate them with commas.

fields.name: city
fields.description: City, district, suburb, town, or village.

fields.name: country
fields.description: Two-letter country code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2).

fields.name: line1
fields.description: Address line 1 (e.g., street, PO Box, or company name).

fields.name: line2
fields.description: Address line 2 (e.g., apartment, suite, unit, or building).

fields.name: postal code
fields.description: ZIP or postal code.

fields.name: state
fields.description: State, county, province, or region.

fields.name: automatic tax
fields.description: Surfaces if automatic tax computation is possible given the current customer location information.

fields.name: ip address
fields.description: A recent IP address of the customer used for tax reporting and tax location inference.

fields.name: active
fields.description: Whether the product is currently available for purchase.

fields.name: description
fields.description: The product's description, meant to be displayable to the customer. Use this field to optionally store a long form explanation of the product being sold for your own rendering purposes.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the object.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The product's name, meant to be displayable to the customer. Whenever this product is sold via a subscription, name will show up on associated invoice line item descriptions.

fields.name: shippable
fields.description: Whether this product is shipped (i.e., physical goods).

fields.name: statement descriptor
fields.description: Extra information about a product which will appear on your customer's credit card statement. In the case that multiple products are billed at once, the first statement descriptor will be used.

fields.name: unit label
fields.description: A label that represents units of this product in Stripe and on customers’ receipts and invoices. When set, this will be included in associated invoice line item descriptions.

fields.name: updated
fields.description: Time at which the object was last updated. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

fields.name: url
fields.description: A URL of a publicly-accessible webpage for this product.

fields.name: height
fields.description: Height, in inches.

fields.name: length
fields.description: Length, in inches.

fields.name: weight
fields.description: Weight, in ounces.

fields.name: width
fields.description: Width, in inches.

fields.name: application fee percent
fields.description: A non-negative decimal between 0 and 100, with at most two decimal places. This represents the percentage of the subscription invoice subtotal that will be transferred to the application owner's Stripe account.

fields.name: billing cycle anchor
fields.description: Determines the date of the first full invoice, and, for plans with month or year intervals, the day of the month for subsequent invoices.

fields.name: cancel at
fields.description: A date in the future at which the subscription will automatically get canceled

fields.name: cancel at period end
fields.description: If the subscription has been canceled with the at_period_end flag set to true, cancel_at_period_end on the subscription will be true. You can use this attribute to determine whether a subscription that has a status of active is scheduled to be canceled at the end of the current period.

fields.name: canceled at
fields.description: If the subscription has been canceled, the date of that cancellation. If the subscription was canceled with cancel_at_period_end, canceled_at will reflect the time of the most recent update request, not the end of the subscription period when the subscription is automatically moved to a canceled state.

fields.name: collection method
fields.description: Either charge_automatically, or send_invoice. When charging automatically, Stripe will attempt to pay this subscription at the end of the cycle using the default source attached to the customer. When sending an invoice, Stripe will email your customer an invoice with payment instructions.

fields.name: days until due
fields.description: Number of days a customer has to pay invoices generated by this subscription. This value will be null for subscriptions where collection_method=charge_automatically.

fields.name: next pending invoice item invoice
fields.description: Specifies the approximate timestamp on which any pending invoice items will be billed according to the schedule provided at pending_invoice_item_interval.

fields.name: start date
fields.description: Date when the subscription was first created. The date might differ from the created date due to backdating.

fields.name: trial end
fields.description: If the subscription has a trial, the end of that trial.

fields.name: trial start
fields.description: If the subscription has a trial, the beginning of that trial.

fields.name: enabled
fields.description: Whether Stripe automatically computes tax on this subscription.

fields.name: amount gte
fields.description: Monetary threshold that triggers the subscription to create an invoice

fields.name: reset billing cycle anchor
fields.description: Indicates if the billing_cycle_anchor should be reset when a threshold is reached. If true, billing_cycle_anchor will be updated to the date/time the threshold was last reached; otherwise, the value will remain unchanged. This value may not be true if the subscription contains items with plans that have aggregate_usage=last_ever.

fields.name: checkout session
fields.description: The Checkout session that this coupon is applied to, if it is applied to a particular session in payment mode. Will not be present for subscription mode.

fields.name: end
fields.description: If the coupon has a duration of repeating, the date that this discount will end. If the coupon has a duration of once or forever, this attribute will be null.

fields.name: invoice
fields.description: The invoice that the discount's coupon was applied to, if it was applied directly to a particular invoice.

fields.name: invoice item
fields.description: The invoice item id (or invoice line item id for invoice line items of type='subscription') that the discount's coupon was applied to, if it was applied directly to a particular invoice item or invoice line item.

fields.name: start
fields.description: Date that the coupon was applied.

fields.name: subscription
fields.description: The subscription that this coupon is applied to, if it is applied to a particular subscription.

fields.name: behavior
fields.description: The payment collection behavior for this subscription while paused. One of keep_as_draft, mark_uncollectible, or void.

fields.name: resumes at
fields.description: The time after which the subscription will resume collecting payments.

fields.name: interval
fields.description: Specifies invoicing frequency. Either day, week, month or year.

fields.name: interval count
fields.description: The number of intervals between invoices. For example, interval=month and interval_count=3 bills every 3 months. Maximum of one year interval allowed (1 year, 12 months, or 52 weeks).

fields.name: billing cycle anchor
fields.description: If the update is applied, determines the date of the first full invoice, and, for plans with month or year intervals, the day of the month for subsequent invoices.

fields.name: expires at
fields.description: The point after which the changes reflected by this update will be discarded and no longer applied.

fields.name: trial end
fields.description: Unix timestamp representing the end of the trial period the customer will get before being charged for the first time, if the update is applied.

fields.name: trial from plan
fields.description: Indicates if a plan's trial_period_days should be applied to the subscription. Setting trial_end per subscription is preferred, and this defaults to false. Setting this flag to true together with trial_end is not allowed. See Using trial periods on subscriptions to learn more.

fields.name: amount percent
fields.description: A non-negative decimal between 0 and 100, with at most two decimal places. This represents the percentage of the subscription invoice subtotal that will be transferred to the destination account. By default, the entire amount is transferred to the destination.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the object.

fields.name: quantity
fields.description: The quantity of the plan to which the customer should be subscribed.

fields.name: subscription
fields.description: The subscription this subscription_item belongs to.

fields.name: usage gte
fields.description: Usage threshold that triggers the subscription to create an invoice

fields.name: active
fields.description: Whether the price can be used for new purchases.

fields.name: billing scheme
fields.description: Describes how to compute the price per period. Either per_unit or tiered. per_unit indicates that the fixed amount (specified in unit_amount or unit_amount_decimal) will be charged per unit in quantity (for prices with usage_type=licensed), or per unit of total usage (for prices with usage_type=metered). tiered indicates that the unit pricing will be computed using a tiering strategy as defined using the tiers and tiers_mode attributes.

fields.name: currency
fields.description: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the object.

fields.name: lookup key
fields.description: A lookup key used to retrieve prices dynamically from a static string. This may be up to 200 characters.

fields.name: nickname
fields.description: A brief description of the price, hidden from customers.

fields.name: tax behavior
fields.description: Specifies whether the price is considered inclusive of taxes or exclusive of taxes. One of inclusive, exclusive, or unspecified. Once specified as either inclusive or exclusive, it cannot be changed.

fields.name: tiers mode
fields.description: Defines if the tiering price should be graduated or volume based. In volume-based tiering, the maximum quantity within a period determines the per unit price. In graduated tiering, pricing can change as the quantity grows.

fields.name: type
fields.description: One of one_time or recurring depending on whether the price is for a one-time purchase or a recurring (subscription) purchase.

fields.name: unit amount
fields.description: The unit amount in %s to be charged, represented as a whole integer if possible. Only set if billing_scheme=per_unit.

fields.name: unit amount decimal
fields.description: The unit amount in %s to be charged, represented as a decimal string with at most 12 decimal places. Only set if billing_scheme=per_unit.

fields.name: active
fields.description: Whether the price can be used for new purchases.

fields.name: billing scheme
fields.description: Describes how to compute the price per period. Either per_unit or tiered. per_unit indicates that the fixed amount (specified in unit_amount or unit_amount_decimal) will be charged per unit in quantity (for prices with usage_type=licensed), or per unit of total usage (for prices with usage_type=metered). tiered indicates that the unit pricing will be computed using a tiering strategy as defined using the tiers and tiers_mode attributes.

fields.name: currency
fields.description: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

fields.name: lookup key
fields.description: A lookup key used to retrieve prices dynamically from a static string. This may be up to 200 characters.

fields.name: nickname
fields.description: A brief description of the price, hidden from customers.

fields.name: tax behavior
fields.description: Specifies whether the price is considered inclusive of taxes or exclusive of taxes. One of inclusive, exclusive, or unspecified. Once specified as either inclusive or exclusive, it cannot be changed.

fields.name: tiers mode
fields.description: Defines if the tiering price should be graduated or volume based. In volume-based tiering, the maximum quantity within a period determines the per unit price. In graduated tiering, pricing can change as the quantity grows.

fields.name: type
fields.description: One of one_time or recurring depending on whether the price is for a one-time purchase or a recurring (subscription) purchase.

fields.name: unit amount
fields.description: The unit amount in %s to be charged, represented as a whole integer if possible. Only set if billing_scheme=per_unit.

fields.name: unit amount decimal
fields.description: The unit amount in %s to be charged, represented as a decimal string with at most 12 decimal places. Only set if billing_scheme=per_unit.

fields.name: aggregate usage
fields.description: Specifies a usage aggregation strategy for prices of usage_type=metered. Allowed values are sum for summing up all usage during a period, last_during_period for using the last usage record reported within a period, last_ever for using the last usage record ever (across period bounds) or max which uses the usage record with the maximum reported usage during a period. Defaults to sum.

fields.name: interval
fields.description: The frequency at which a subscription is billed. One of day, week, month or year.

fields.name: interval count
fields.description: The number of intervals (specified in the interval attribute) between subscription billings. For example, interval=month and interval_count=3 bills every 3 months.

fields.name: usage type
fields.description: Configures how the quantity per period should be determined. Can be either metered or licensed. licensed automatically bills the quantity set when adding it to a subscription. metered aggregates the total usage based on usage records. Defaults to licensed.

fields.name: divide by
fields.description: Divide usage by this number.

fields.name: round
fields.description: After division, either round the result up or down.
